intro: Thalictrum brachyandrum, commonly known as the short-stamen meadow rue, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers with prominent stamens, which are a distinctive feature of the species. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Thalictrum brachyandrum is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
